title: Quiz 6: Physiological Measurements & Chaperoning
topicName: Essential Knowledge and Skills for Healthcare Assistants
description: Test your ability to perform vital signs measurements and understand the role of a chaperone.

questions.question: What is the formula for calculating Body Mass Index (BMI)?
questions.explanation: BMI is Weight (kg) divided by Height (m) squared.

questions.question: Match the pulse site with its anatomical location:
A heart rate above 100 bpm is called ___BLANK___, while a rate below 50/60 bpm is called ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: Tachy- means fast, Brady- means slow.

questions.question: When should a chaperone be offered? (Select all that apply)

options.text: When the doctor/nurse feels it is necessary
Only if the patient is under 16

questions.explanation: Chaperones protect both patient and professional during intimate exams, or whenever requested/deemed necessary by either party.

questions.question: A family member or friend is the best person to act as a formal chaperone during a clinical examination.
questions.explanation: Family/friends are NOT appropriate formal chaperones. They cannot provide independent clinical protection/witnessing. An independent, trained staff member is required.
questions.hint: Can a family member act as an independent professional witness?

questions.question: What is the normal range for oxygen saturation (SpO2) in a healthy adult?
What is the term for a high body temperature (fever)?
Which factors can affect the accuracy of a pulse oximetry reading? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Varnish, cold, and bright light interfere with the light sensor. Height does not.
questions.hint: Things that block light or reduce blood flow to fingers.

questions.question: Where should the chaperone stand during an examination?

options.text: Outside the curtain to give privacy
Inside the curtain, usually at the head of the couch
By the door to stop people coming in
Wherever they can see the computer screen

questions.explanation: They must be inside the curtain to observe the procedure (protection) but usually at the head to support the patient.
questions.hint: They need to see what is happening.

questions.question: When measuring respiratory rate, it is best to count breaths while holding the patient's ___BLANK___ so they are unaware you are watching their breathing.
questions.explanation: If patients know you are counting breathing, they alter it. Pretending to take a pulse allows for an accurate count.
questions.hint: Pretend you are doing another check.
